bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Leatha Logan, September 28, 1943

div1.p: Hench showed the booklet, which Logan had sent, to Moran. Hench requests additional copies so he can distribute them among the yellow fever personnel.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Leatha Logan, September 28, 1943
div1.opener:
STATION HOSPITAL
CAMP CARSON COLORADO
28 September 43
Miss Leatha Logan
1505 West Nelson Street
Marion, Indianna
My dear Miss Logan:
div1.p:
I was very interested indeed to receive your booklet about
three weeks ago as I was about to go to Washington. Incidentally,
while I was in Washington, I saw Mr. John Moran who was ill for a
while in Walter Reed Hospital. I showed him your book which he
studied with much interest. He is very anxious to have a copy.
Will you be putting them on sale, or would you be willing to send
me a half dozen copies? I should like to send them to various of
the yellow fever personnel.

By the way, you made one mistake which you might keep in
mind. Dr. Domingo Ramos, whom you mention on pages 33 and 49 was
not the owner of the farm. He was the Secretary of War whom we
interviewed there and is still very much alive. The owner of the
farm has long since died.

Let me thank you again very kindly for sending me the
booklet.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely, PHILIP S. HENCH
Lieut Colonel, M. C. PSH:rw
